verses.verse: He, <S%H376><s%> that being often <S%H8433>reproved<s%> <S%H7185>hardeneth<s%> his <S%H6203>neck,<s%> shall <S%H6621>suddenly<s%> be <S%H7665>destroyed,<s%> and that <S%H369>without<s%> <S%H4832>remedy.<s%>

When the <S%H6662>righteous<s%> are in <S%H7235>authority,<s%> the <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H8055>rejoice:<s%> but when the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> beareth <S%H4910>rule,<s%> the <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H584>mourn.<s%>

Whoso <S%H376><s%> <S%H157>loveth<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> <S%H8055>rejoiceth<s%> his <S%H1>father:<s%> but he that keepeth <S%H7462>company<s%> with <S%H2181>harlots<s%> <S%H6>spendeth<s%> his <S%H1952>substance.<s%>
The <S%H4428>king<s%> by <S%H4941>judgment<s%> <S%H5975>establisheth<s%> the <S%H776>land:<s%> but <S%H376>he<s%> that receiveth <S%H8641>gifts<s%> <S%H2040>overthroweth<s%> it.
A <S%H1397>man<s%> that <S%H2505>flattereth<s%> <S%H5921><s%> his <S%H7453>neighbor<s%> <S%H6566>spreadeth<s%> a <S%H7568>net<s%> <S%H5921>for<s%> his <S%H6471>feet.<s%>
In the <S%H6588>transgression<s%> of an <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> there is a <S%H4170>snare:<s%> but the <S%H6662>righteous<s%> doth <S%H7442>sing<s%> and <S%H8055>rejoice.<s%>
The <S%H6662>righteous<s%> <S%H3045>considereth<s%> the <S%H1779>cause<s%> of the <S%H1800>poor:<s%> but the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> <S%H995>regardeth<s%> <S%H3808>not<s%> to <S%H1847>know<s%> it.
Scornful <S%H3944><s%> <S%H376>men<s%> bring a city into a <S%H6315>snare:<s%> <S%H7151><s%> but <S%H2450>wise<s%> men turn <S%H7725>away<s%> <S%H639>wrath.<s%>

If a <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H8199>contendeth<s%> <S%H854>with<s%> a <S%H191>foolish<s%> <S%H376>man,<s%> whether he <S%H7264>rage<s%> or <S%H7832>laugh,<s%> there is <S%H369>no<s%> <S%H5183>rest.<s%>
The <S%H376>bloodthirsty<s%> <S%H1818><s%> <S%H8130>hate<s%> the <S%H8535>upright:<s%> but the <S%H3477>just<s%> <S%H1245>seek<s%> his <S%H5315>soul.<s%>
A <S%H3684>fool<s%> <S%H3318>uttereth<s%> <S%H3605>all<s%> his <S%H7307>mind:<s%> but a <S%H2450>wise<s%> man <S%H7623>keepeth<s%> it in till <S%H268>afterwards.<s%>
If a <S%H4910>ruler<s%> <S%H7181>hearken<s%> <S%H5921>to<s%> <S%H1697>lies,<s%> <S%H8267><s%> <S%H3605>all<s%> his <S%H8334>servants<s%> are <S%H7563>wicked.<s%>
The <S%H7326>poor<s%> and the <S%H8501>deceitful<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> meet <S%H6298>together:<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H215>lighteneth<s%> <S%H8147>both<s%> their <S%H5869>eyes.<s%>
The <S%H4428>king<s%> that <S%H571>faithfully<s%> <S%H8199>judgeth<s%> the <S%H1800>poor,<s%> his <S%H3678>throne<s%> shall be <S%H3559>established<s%> <S%H5703>forever.<s%>
The <S%H7626>rod<s%> and <S%H8433>reproof<s%> <S%H5414>give<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom:<s%> but a <S%H5288>child<s%> <S%H7971>left<s%> to himself bringeth his <S%H517>mother<s%> to <S%H954>shame.<s%>
When the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> are <S%H7235>multiplied,<s%> <S%H6588>transgression<s%> <S%H7235>increaseth:<s%> but the <S%H6662>righteous<s%> shall <S%H7200>see<s%> their <S%H4658>fall.<s%>
Correct <S%H3256><s%> thy <S%H1121>son,<s%> and he shall give thee <S%H5117>rest;<s%> yea, he shall <S%H5414>give<s%> <S%H4574>delight<s%> unto thy <S%H5315>soul.<s%>
Where there is <S%H369>no<s%> <S%H2377>vision,<s%> the <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H6544>perish:<s%> but he that <S%H8104>keepeth<s%> the <S%H8451>law,<s%> <S%H835>happy<s%> is he.
A <S%H5650>servant<s%> will <S%H3808>not<s%> be <S%H3256>corrected<s%> by <S%H1697>words:<s%> for <S%H3588>though<s%> he <S%H995>understand<s%> he will <S%H369>not<s%> <S%H4617>answer.<s%>
Seest <S%H2372><s%> thou a <S%H376>man<s%> that is <S%H213>hasty<s%> in his <S%H1697>words?<s%> there is more <S%H8615>hope<s%> of a <S%H3684>fool<s%> than <S%H4480>of<s%> him.
He that delicately bringeth <S%H6445>up<s%> his <S%H5650>servant<s%> from a <S%H4480>child<s%> <S%H5290><s%> shall have him <S%H1961>become<s%> his <S%H4497>son<s%> at the <S%H319>length.<s%>
An <S%H639>angry<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> stirreth <S%H1624>up<s%> <S%H4066>strife,<s%> and a <S%H2534>furious<s%> <S%H1167>man<s%> <S%H7227>aboundeth<s%> in <S%H6588>transgression.<s%>
A <S%H120>man's<s%> <S%H1346>pride<s%> shall bring him <S%H8213>low:<s%> but <S%H3519>honor<s%> shall <S%H8551>uphold<s%> the <S%H8217>humble<s%> in <S%H7307>spirit.<s%>

Whoso is <S%H2505>partner<s%> <S%H5973>with<s%> a <S%H1590>thief<s%> <S%H8130>hateth<s%> his own <S%H5315>soul:<s%> he <S%H8085>heareth<s%> <S%H423>cursing,<s%> and <S%H5046>betrayeth<s%> it <S%H3808>not.<s%>
The <S%H2731>fear<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H5414>bringeth<s%> a <S%H4170>snare:<s%> but whoso putteth his <S%H982>trust<s%> in the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> shall be <S%H7682>safe.<s%>
Many <S%H7227><s%> <S%H1245>seek<s%> the <S%H4910>ruler's<s%> <S%H6440>favor;<s%> but every <S%H376>man's<s%> <S%H4941>judgment<s%> cometh from the <S%H4480>LORD.<s%> <S%H3068><s%>

An <S%H5766>unjust<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> is an <S%H8441>abomination<s%> to the <S%H6662>just:<s%> and he that is <S%H3477>upright<s%> in the <S%H1870>way<s%> is <S%H8441>abomination<s%> to the <S%H7563>wicked.<s%>
